issue.title: System fails to run all of a sudden (on file that ran fine moments before) from seemingly outside (packages) cause.

content.raw:
Installed Reveal requirements on secondary machine and was able to run the project.  This issues appears to be an environmental change on this system, but what could have caused it eludes me as nothing was explicitly applied between the working attempt and the non-working attempt.  I am going to purge gazebo on this machine and reset.  Below is the environment as it was before everything went sour.

```
#!c++
gazebo from gazebo_4.0 branch tip
sdformat from sdf_2.0 branch tip
```
following http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install for optional physics on Precise
```
#!c++
dart_core4.1 from debian
bullet 2.82 from debian
simbody 3.3 from debian
```

The exceptions generated were
```
#!c++
[Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Couldn't Find Child Link[ur10::base_link]

[Err] [Model.cc:138] LoadJoint Failed
[Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Couldn't Find Parent Link[ur10::wrist_3_link]

[Err] [Model.cc:138] LoadJoint Failed
```
The links do exist in the models and it was somehow related to nesting models.  But just to reiterate, this model was working moments before the anomaly and it does continue to work on another machine.  The joints in question are fixed joints that weld the base_link to the world and the wrist_3_link to the gripper.
content.html:
Installed Reveal requirements on secondary machine and was able to run the project. This issues appears to be an environmental change on this system, but what could have caused it eludes me as nothing was explicitly applied between the working attempt and the non-working attempt. I am going to purge gazebo on this machine and reset. Below is the environment as it was before everything went sour.

gazebo from gazebo_4.0 branch tip
sdformat from sdf_2.0 branch tip

following http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install for optional physics on Precise

dart_core4.1 from debian
bullet 2.82 from debian
simbody 3.3 from debian

The exceptions generated were

[Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Couldn't Find Child Link[ur10::base_link]

[Err] [Model.cc:138] LoadJoint Failed
[Err] [Exception.cc:52] EXCEPTION: Couldn't Find Parent Link[ur10::wrist_3_link]

[Err] [Model.cc:138] LoadJoint Failed

The links do exist in the models and it was somehow related to nesting models. But just to reiterate, this model was working moments before the anomaly and it does continue to work on another machine. The joints in question are fixed joints that weld the base_link to the world and the wrist_3_link to the gripper.
